intro: Rhododendron weyrichii var. psilostylum, commonly known as the Yunnan azale, is a rare and ornamental evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with acidic soils and high humidity. It is valued for its striking floral display and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited natural range and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
